subject: [Fwd: Re: How to test private methods in a class.]
msgSnippet: I suspect this belongs with the group, and not just me, so I m forwarding it on. ... Subject: Re: How to test private methods in a class. Date: Sun, 04 Sep
messageBody:
I suspect this belongs with the group, and not just me, so I'm
forwarding it on.

-------- Original Message --------
Subject: Re: How to test private methods in a class.
Date: Sun, 04 Sep 2005 19:14:29 -0000
From: fujeyla <fujeyla@...>
To: junit-owner@yahoogroups.com

For some of you who don't know, give JUnitX 5.2 a try: it makes a lot
easier the private stuff tests. Using it with javassist avoids some
Proxy classes creation just to test: all those classes are created
during the test runtime... Now it also allows to test
private/protected static methods.

Just have a look at this page where you can find a "how to" use JUnitX
as well as this new version, I mean the 5.2 one.

Link: http://www.xp-swiss.org/wiki/index.php?title=JUnitX_how_to_eng

Look at the end of the page to find the jar file link.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
